intro: Asplundia schizotepala, commonly known as the slit-leaf arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source. Asplundia schizotepala thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
